## Steps to reproduce

```
-Open a new Shell
-Get-NetTCPConnection | Select-Object -First 1

Note: the issue only happens the first time the command is run. Sometimes it happens the second time as well but it's not consistent. After the first 1-2 times running get-nettcpconnection it works as expected and contains the OwningProcess column in the output
```

## Expected behavior

```
LocalAddress                        LocalPort RemoteAddress                       RemotePort State       AppliedSetting OwningProcess
------------                        --------- -------------                       ---------- -----       -------------- -------------
::                                  62357     ::                                  0          Bound                      14776
```

## Actual behavior

```
LocalAddress                        LocalPort RemoteAddress                       RemotePort State       AppliedSetting
------------                        --------- -------------                       ---------- -----       --------------
::                                  62357     ::                                  0          Bound
```

## Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.1.2
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.1.2
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.19041
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```
